reviews.sentence: Great hotel close to most things needed. It was a great experience. The staff was really accommodating and helpful. The only downside was that there was no continental breakfast only a breakfast bistro. Otherwise it was great. Really comfy beds and pillows too.
Stay here often. Very friendly staff. Clean rooms. Has a bar. Can walk to some of the restaurants.

Clean convenient and friendly. I was here for four nights on a business trip and really enjoyed my stay. The location is great right off of I10 and surrounded by everyday dining and shopping options. I stayed on the I10 side of the hotel and just did not experience the noise level that some other reviewers did. Maybe I was just too tired but I slept just fine. My room was large and very clean. There was more than adequate work space a small refrigerator and a comfortable sofa. I also had a small balcony which was nice but clean. not so much. You can not keep birds away but I am not certain the chairs or floor there had been cleaned in some time. I just threw a towel on the chair and it was okay but not very inviting. Another very minor issue was that the shower head in my room lacked sufficient pressure unles you adjusted the head to that one blasting stream of water. The coffee shop doubles as the bar in the evening and there are multiple very comfortable lounging areas throughout the lobby area. The Starbucks on site is nice but know if you go around the wall toward the pool area and public computers you will find the complimentary coffee. I came back to the room after work one day to freshen up before dinner in and out in 15 minutes or less. I think it was around 40. As luck would have it housekeeping knocked on my door in that little window of time. I asked her to please give me just 10 minutes. She never came back. No real harm done but it was the one service issue I had the whole time I was there. I enjoyed my stay and would not hesitate to return.

nice and quiet room. The first time was noisy facing interstate but last three times had great quiet enough rooms. The meals I did not find good. Hamburger dry and hard. Breakfast eggs were rubbery like. No longer eat meals there. But everything else including staff is awesome. Staff and nice rooms. Location on Siegan Lane Baton Rouge La. In middle if city easy to get around. Food.

The location is mice it is right by the mall so you will not be bored of your staying there between trips and the rooms were immaculate. All though i got a soda from the lobby and found it was 4 months out of date probably because it was two and a half dollars and really wanted a breakfast but they do not provide one. Other than those two things my stay was great. did not really see about staff other than the lobby girl.

It was OK. Nothing special about the hotel. it is close in proximity to local restaurants etc but I was expecting more. Before I arrived I call to check the status of my reservation I was placed on hold for 30 minutes before being rushed off the phone. The hotel itself was nice but there was nothing special about it for the price. If you need something close to everything cool if not I had recommend keep searching.

No Breakfast or coffee. No Free breakfast or coffee. You have one person serving and making the paid breakfast and coffee in the mornings. Expect long lines. Plan to eat your breakfast somewhere else. Clean hotel. Nice pool. Nice exercise room. Loud hotel. Stairwell doors slam shut. Security guard delivers your hotel bill at 3 am. May wake you up. All doors slam shut. Locked out of room after one day. Rooms face loud highway with little room noise insulation. Loud. There are better options.
Exceptional. They do not offer complimentary breakfast.

Not stay again. Hotel staff pleasant. Horrendous smell in hallway. Sofa was not comfortable to sit on. Pillows are nice but bed mattress was not. Convenience. Smell better mattress lower prices for coffee and breakfast as they are overpriced.

will not stay here again second chance was given. Paid extra for breakfast and it was a drink and a choice of 1 thing at the bar area. not worth it. Front desk lady that was working when we checked in was EXTREMELY rude. Stayed here before and it was just okay but will not stay again.

It is a older remodeled Courtyard. The lobby is starting to show its age. The rooms are standard and comfortable just also showing their use. On the plus side there are plenty of restaurants near by so you are not at their mercy. If you need a Mariot product in. Baton Rouge this is a solid choice.
Great place to stay. Very easy access to several major restaurants and stores. Within walking distance.
Great hotel. Very clean Very comfortable stay an also great staff great location that s close to restaurant an shopping.

For a layover hotel on our way to AL. it was perfect. The breakfast food was delicious. The bed was very comfortable. Loved the pull out love seat. I want one. Up to date decor. The place was spotless. even the parking lot. No trash or cigarette butts anywhere. The pool area was clean. Just that if you paid for breakfast your choices were muffins coffee cake etc. If you wanted to waffles or French toast or something similar that was extra. But. the coffee cake was delicious and the banana nut French toast was worth the price.
Clean rooms friendly staff close to local retail and restaurants newly remodeled.
Room was spacious and very clean. Hotel in a good location with Sam ’s Walmart and several restaurants less than a mile away. Enjoyed my stay there and will definitely be staying there again.

Mary Kay. Leshawn Davis Mary are great receptionists they both made my stay awesome. They were very helpful on Restaurants nail salons Entertainment local stores. Mildred Goserand Leshawn Davis were excellent servers in the Bistro.

Awesome hotel that is been renovated and modernized so some of the pictures are deceptive of what it actually is. The lounge is great and is a great spot to enjoy breakfast andor work from your laptop. it is in a fantastic location with restaurants Top Golf and known stores right off of I10.
Very nice staff property very clean I thought I had booked a place with complimentary breakfast but I was mistaken that is the only thing I was disappointed about Location was great.

Beware of Bistro. Nice hotel but very noisy from highway traffic all night. The bistro which is featured as a restaurant has a limited menu of average tasting small quantity items. I prepaid for 2 breakfasts and they turned out to be continental only meaning a drink and choice of two food items muffin whole piece of fruit or yogart. We wanted eggs so two 2 egg omelettes with potatoes only was 270. And they were pre frozen and heated up. Great place just go somewhere else for breakfast.
